title: 1987 Porsche 911 Carrera Targa G50
description: This 1987 Porsche 911 Carrera Targa is powered by a 3.2-liter flat-six paired with a G50 five-speed manual transaxle, and it is equipped with 16″ Fuchs alloy wheels, Turbo tie rods, Bilstein sport shocks, and a limited-slip differential. The car is finished in Venetian Blue Metallic over Silver Grey special leather and features a removable targa roof panel, front sport seats, a Blaupunkt Bremen SQR 46 stereo, cruise control, and air conditioning. The turbo tie rods were installed, and the sway bar bushings, clutch assembly, and slave cylinder were replaced in January 2025. This Carrera Targa was purchased by the current owner in October 2024, and it is now offered on dealer consignment with tools, a jack, the owner's manual, service records, a clean Carfax report, and a clean North Carolina title.
author: bringatrailer
excerpt: Bid for the chance to own a 1987 Porsche 911 Carrera Targa G50 at auction with Bring a Trailer, the home of the best vintage and classic cars online. Lot #196,022.
text: This 1987 Porsche 911 Carrera Targa is powered by a 3.2-liter flat-six paired with a G50 five-speed manual transaxle, and it is equipped with 16″ Fuchs alloy wheels, Turbo tie rods, Bilstein sport shocks, and a limited-slip differential. The car is finished in Venetian Blue Metallic over Silver Grey special leather and features a removable targa roof panel, front sport seats, a Blaupunkt Bremen SQR 46 stereo, cruise control, and air conditioning. The turbo tie rods were installed, and the sway bar bushings, clutch assembly, and slave cylinder were replaced in January 2025. This Carrera Targa was purchased by the current owner in October 2024, and it is now offered on dealer consignment with tools, a jack, the owner’s manual, service records, a clean Carfax report, and a clean North Carolina title. The car is finished in Venetian Blue Metallic and features a black removable targa roof panel, integrated fog lights, and heated power-adjustable side mirrors. The hood and right fender have been refinished, and the rear valance was modified to accommodate a dual exhaust system. The front trunk and deck lid shocks were replaced in May 2024. The 16″ Fuchs alloy wheels are mounted with Michelin Pilot Sport tires. The car has been fitted with Bilstein sport shocks, Turbo tie rods, and a Rennline strut tower brace. Braking is handled by four-wheel discs. The front tires and steering support sleeve were replaced in May 2024, the turbo tie rods were installed, and the sway bar bushings were replaced in January 2025. The front sport seats are trimmed in Silver Grey special leather and joined by black upper surfaces. Amenities include a Blaupunkt Bremen SQR 46 stereo, Pyle speakers, cruise control, air conditioning, and power windows. The leather-wrapped steering wheel frames VDO instrumentation including a central tachometer with a 6,300-rpm redline as well as a 170-mph speedometer, a Quarz clock, and gauges for oil level, oil pressure, oil temperature, and fuel level. The six-digit odometer shows 55k miles, approximately 4k of which were added under current ownership. A note in the November 2021 service invoice states that the odometer was inoperable. The 3.2-liter M930/25 flat-six features Bosch Motronic engine management and was factory-rated at 217 horsepower and 195 lb-ft of torque. Power is sent to the rear wheels through a G50 five-speed manual transaxle and an optional limited-slip differential. The clutch kit, slave cylinder, and guide tube were replaced in January 2025. Decoding the option sticker reveals the following information: L36P – Venetian Blue Metallic HQ – Silver Grey special leather with black accents C02 – Version for US 018 – Steering wheel with elevated hub 158 – Blaupunkt Reno SQR 46 cassette stereo 220 – Limited-slip differential 286 – Intensified windscreen washer 288 – Headlamp washer 341 – Central locking system 383 – Sports seat, left, electrical height adjustment 387 – Sports seat, right, electrical height adjustment 395 – 16″ Fuchs forged alloy wheels 424 – Automatic heating control 425 – Rear window wiper 454 – Cruise control 975 – Velour carpet for trunk The Carfax report is free of accidents or other reported damage, and it lists an initial entry in July 1995. html:
This 1987 Porsche 911 Carrera Targa is powered by a 3.2-liter flat-six paired with a G50 five-speed manual transaxle, and it is equipped with 16″ Fuchs alloy wheels, Turbo tie rods, Bilstein sport shocks, and a limited-slip differential. The car is finished in Venetian Blue Metallic over Silver Grey special leather and features a removable targa roof panel, front sport seats, a Blaupunkt Bremen SQR 46 stereo, cruise control, and air conditioning. The turbo tie rods were installed, and the sway bar bushings, clutch assembly, and slave cylinder were replaced in January 2025. This Carrera Targa was purchased by the current owner in October 2024, and it is now offered on dealer consignment with tools, a jack, the owner’s manual, service records, a clean Carfax report, and a clean North Carolina title.

The car is finished in Venetian Blue Metallic and features a black removable targa roof panel, integrated fog lights, and heated power-adjustable side mirrors. The hood and right fender have been refinished, and the rear valance was modified to accommodate a dual exhaust system. The front trunk and deck lid shocks were replaced in May 2024.

The 16″ Fuchs alloy wheels are mounted with Michelin Pilot Sport tires. The car has been fitted with Bilstein sport shocks, Turbo tie rods, and a Rennline strut tower brace. Braking is handled by four-wheel discs. The front tires and steering support sleeve were replaced in May 2024, the turbo tie rods were installed, and the sway bar bushings were replaced in January 2025.

The front sport seats are trimmed in Silver Grey special leather and joined by black upper surfaces. Amenities include a Blaupunkt Bremen SQR 46 stereo, Pyle speakers, cruise control, air conditioning, and power windows.

The leather-wrapped steering wheel frames VDO instrumentation including a central tachometer with a 6,300-rpm redline as well as a 170-mph speedometer, a Quarz clock, and gauges for oil level, oil pressure, oil temperature, and fuel level. The six-digit odometer shows 55k miles, approximately 4k of which were added under current ownership. A note in the November 2021 service invoice states that the odometer was inoperable.

The 3.2-liter M930/25 flat-six features Bosch Motronic engine management and was factory-rated at 217 horsepower and 195 lb-ft of torque.

Power is sent to the rear wheels through a G50 five-speed manual transaxle and an optional limited-slip differential. The clutch kit, slave cylinder, and guide tube were replaced in January 2025.

Decoding the option sticker reveals the following information:

  • L36P – Venetian Blue Metallic
  • HQ – Silver Grey special leather with black accents
  • C02 – Version for US
  • 018 – Steering wheel with elevated hub
  • 158 – Blaupunkt Reno SQR 46 cassette stereo
  • 220 – Limited-slip differential
  • 286 – Intensified windscreen washer
  • 288 – Headlamp washer
  • 341 – Central locking system
  • 383 – Sports seat, left, electrical height adjustment
  • 387 – Sports seat, right, electrical height adjustment
  • 395 – 16″ Fuchs forged alloy wheels
  • 424 – Automatic heating control
  • 425 – Rear window wiper
  • 454 – Cruise control
  • 975 – Velour carpet for trunk

The Carfax report is free of accidents or other reported damage, and it lists an initial entry in July 1995.
